title: Inline Formatting Context
description: The Inline Formatting Context in HTML dictates how inline elements align horizontally and wrap text within lines.
content: The concept that explains how inline-level elements, like text or links, are arranged horizontally within a line. These elements sit next to each other and if there's not enough space, the content wraps to the next line. Inline elements don't start on a new line and fit within the flow of surrounding text.
